title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 §§ 753-3.11 - Requirements concerning underground facilities in danger of failing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 §§ 753-3.11 - Requirements concerning underground facilities in danger of failing

State Regulations
(a) An excavator
who by removing the surrounding materials exposes an underground facility which
in his or her judgment appears to have failed or to be in potential danger of
failing from corrosion or other causes shall immediately report such condition
to the operator of such underground facility. (b) The excavator shall delay any further
work in the immediate vicinity of such underground facility which could
jeopardize it but may proceed in areas not affecting the questionable
facility. (c) The excavator may
proceed in such immediate vicinity after the operator responds and takes
necessary action in regard thereto and advises the excavator that he or she may
proceed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
§§
753-3.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
